means: 在国库方面，财政上，在国库岁入方面

sentence.Network_en: Many members are determined to prove that they are fiscally responsible.
sentence.Network_cn: 很多成员都决心证明他们在财政问题上是负责任的。

sentence.Network_en: The scheme would be fiscally dangerous.
sentence.Network_cn: 该计划将可能陷入财政危险。

sentence.Network_en: Nor will fiscally stretched governments pump more money into the political equivalent of a leper colony.
sentence.Network_cn: 财政吃紧的政府也不愿将更多的钱投入这个避之唯恐不及的政治瘟疫区.

PerfectNetExp.abs: earmarks are symbolically potent but fiscally inconsequential , since they parcel out spending rather than alter its level .专项拨款象征意义巨大，但在财政上无足轻重，因为它只对支出的分割有影响，不会改变其规模。

as my fiscally conservative friend Senator Dale Bumpers used to say : you let me write $ 200 billion a year in hot checks and I'll show you a good time , too .正如我的朋友、在财政问题上比较保守的参议员戴尔.邦珀斯过去常说的那样：“你让我一年开2000亿美元的支票，我也会给你好日子过。”
on the eve of the crisis Ireland seemed to be in good shape , fiscally speaking , with a balanced budget and a low level of public debt .在危机爆发前夕，爱尔兰看起来运行良好。从财政上讲，政府的预算平衡而且公共负债也保持在一个低的水平。

list.abs: 财政悬崖财政悬崖(Fiscal Cliff)一词最早是由美国联准会(Fed)主席柏南克(Ben Bernanke)提出，意指到2012年底，美国政府减税优惠 …

entry.tran: (政府)财政的;国库的;(尤指)税收的
entry.def: Fiscal is used to describe something that relates to government money or public money, especially taxes.

example.ex: ...in 1987, when the government tightened fiscal policy.
example.tran: 在1987 年，当时政府紧缩财政政策
